title: About
text:
MTA Research is an independent research consultancy specialising in crime science, retail loss prevention, and applied analytics. We help translate evidence into practical strategies, measurement frameworks, and decision-ready reporting.
MTA Research is led by Michael Townsley (PhD), a criminologist with two decades of experience in crime science and prevention. This includes published research, international experience, and previous appointments at leading institutions.

title: About
text:
Our focus
We work at the intersection of:

Retail crime and loss (incidents, people, products, places, processes)
Fraud and abuse (behaviour mapping, opportunity reduction, controls and measurement)
Evaluation (credible designs that fit real-world rollouts and constraints)

title: About
text:
Our approach
We prioritise:

Decision-first research — start from the decision you need to make, then design methods to support it
Rigour without theatre — clear assumptions, transparent limits, results that stand up to scrutiny
Implementation realism — recommendations that can be delivered in operational settings
Clarity — plain language, concise reporting, and well-structured outputs

title: About
text:
Independence
MTA Research is an independent consultancy and is not affiliated with or endorsed by any university or institution.

title: Services
text: MTA Research provides independent, evidence-led support across prevention strategy, analytics, and evaluation. Engagements are tailored to your decision context, data environment, and operational constraints.

title: Services
text:
1) Retail crime research & analytics
What we do
We help make sense of incident, people, product and location data to identify what is driving loss and what is most likely to reduce it.
Typical questions

Where is loss concentrated, and what patterns are emerging over time?
What distinguishes routine error from fraud/abuse signals?
Which stores, products, or processes should be prioritised for prevention effort?

Common outputs

Analytical report (plain-language findings, clear visuals, defensible methods)
Executive brief with prioritised recommendations
Dashboards/figures suitable for operational and executive audiences

title: Services
text:
2) Fraud & abuse prevention
What we do
We use crime scripting and opportunity-reduction thinking to map how abuse occurs and where controls can be applied with minimal friction.
Typical questions

How is policy being exploited, and at which steps does it become preventable?
Which controls are likely to reduce opportunity without harming legitimate customers?
What indicators can be monitored to detect emerging abuse types?

Common outputs

Behaviour typology and risk indicators (plain language, operationally interpretable)
Prevention script / control map with options and trade-offs
Measurement approach to track change after implementation

title: Services
text:
3) Program design & evaluation
What we do
We design measurement frameworks and evaluation plans that match the realities of rollout, compliance, and operational variation.
Typical questions

Is the program working, for whom, and under what conditions?
What is the best feasible design for credible measurement (given constraints)?
What is the likely uplift/ROI, and what assumptions drive it?

Common outputs

Evaluation plan (questions, measures, sampling, timeline)
Pre/post survey instruments and analysis plan (where appropriate)
Results reporting that supports decision-making, not just description

title: Services
text:
4) Workshops & training
What we do
We run practical sessions that help teams apply crime-science tools to their own context and produce usable outputs.
Formats

Short skills sessions (90–180 minutes) on core tools and interpretation
Co-design workshops to generate prevention actions and prioritise controls
Facilitation for cross-team alignment on definitions, measures and next steps

Common outputs

Workshop pack (templates, examples, facilitation materials)
Summary of outputs and prioritised action list
Follow-on recommendations for implementation and measurement

What we do

Retail crime research & analytics
Analyse incidents, products, people and places; diagnose drivers of loss; produce clear, decision-ready insights.
Fraud & abuse prevention
Map problem behaviours using crime scripting; identify weak points; design opportunity-reduction controls that work in real operations.
Program design & evaluation
Build measurement frameworks through to quasi-experimental evaluation; track uplift, ROI and operational impact.
Workshops & training
Short, practical sessions on crime-science tools and prevention scripting; co-design workshops with store and central teams.

title: Evidence-based prevention and analytics for retail
text:
Why MTA Research

Applied academic rigour
MTA Research is led by Michael Townsley (PhD), a criminologist with two decades in crime science and retail loss prevention. Our work draws on peer-reviewed research, transparent methods, and a practical orientation to implementation.


Retail-first, results-focused
We have experience supporting major retailers and industry bodies across Australia and New Zealand. We focus on outputs that are executive-ready and operationally useful.


Data governance & confidentiality
We treat confidentiality as a default. We work under NDAs where required and use privacy-aware approaches to business data and survey measurement.
